Recurring Kirby boss Kabula fires what appear to be Bullet Bills during some attacks and Kirby's Stone ability has a rare chance of turning into a golden statue of Mario. Kirby appears in Mario comics such as Super Mario-Kun and cameos on a movie poster in Mario and Luigi: Superstar Saga.

Recurring Kirby boss Kabula fires what appear to be Bullet Bills during some attacks and Kirby's Stone ability has a rare chance of turning into a golden statue of Mario. Kirby appears in Mario comics such as Super Mario-Kun and cameos on a movie poster in Mario and Luigi: Superstar Saga.

The ghost that possesses Edd and Matt in "Trick or Threat" is Kate from Crash Zoom. A PowerEdd action figure and a poster of "Space Cats" was in "Crash Zoom - Movie Massacre"; Additionally, Edd and Tom and a poster of "ASDF Land" appear in "Crash Zoom - Fingered"; characters from Crash Zoom can be seen in a picture in "The End (Part 2)". In "Crash Zoom - Cover Up", a kid from the episode "Fun Dead" appears in one of the pictures.

path.name: Asdfmovie
path.description: The stegosaurus from asdfmovie appears in "Crash Zoom - Out Of Time". Crash Zoom also features many other references to asdfmovie throughout the series. Additionally, Lucy appears in the asdfmovie music video "REAL MAN!"

path.name: Ghostbusters

path.name: Mega Man
path.description: Boktai and the Megaman Battle Network series have had multiple crossovers with eachother. Battle Network 4 features Django at various points, including during a mini-quest to defeat ShadeMan.EXE. in Boktai 2, ShadeMan.EXE becomes a post-game boss. There are also "crossover battles" that can be played by using a wireless adapter to connect to Battle Network 5. Due to declining sales of the Boktai series in the west, English releases began cutting crossovers between games. In Rockman.EXE6 (Battle Network 6) there are various references to Boktai 3 (which never saw an english release). In Lunar Knights, the 4th Boktai game, the Japanese version links with Shooting Star Rockman (Megaman Star Force), allowing players to fight Taurus Fire. Defeating him unlock Omega-Xis as a terrenial to assist the player.

Love Handel from Phineas and Ferb makes a cameo in the Hamster and Gretel episode Flake It Till You Make It. path.name: Adventure Time
path.description: The Lost Cases of Ooo is a crossover episode between Villainous and Adventure Time. Finn's sword can be seen in the Villainous short "The Portrait of Evil". Characters from Adventure Time briefly appear in "The Lost Cases of Boxmore". Many other villain orientation videos use clips from Adventure Time. The Villainous game Maldad Mecanica features enemies based on Finn and Jake, Hunson Abadder appears in a group photo in The Lost Cases of the Future, the Ice King appears in one of the Villainous Comics strips and Gunther appears in Trap-ical Resort.

path.name: Fortnite

Some outfits from StreetPass Mii Plaza are reused as outfits for the Mii Fighters.

The titular characters from The Adventures of Super Mario Bros. 3 episode "Sneaky Lying Cheating Giant Ninja Koopas" as well as The Koopa Bros. from Paper Mario are based on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles; The episode "The Gaminator" of the 2003 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series features a reference to Super Mario Bros.

Later, Downloadable Content would be released to add John Wick Weapons and masks to commemorate the game, John Wick Chronicles VR and another pack that added a few heists, some masks, and a few more weapons to commemorate the release of John Wick: Chapter Two.

There are many references to Duke Nukem in the dialogue of some Serious Sam games, often calling him "Blondie".

path.name: Pac-Man
path.description: The X68000 version of Galaga '88 features a bonus level with the ghosts from Pac-Man, while the fighter from Galaxian is unlockable in Pac-Man Kart Rally and a theme with Galaxian characters appears in Pac-Man 99; Pac-Man also appears in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition and a Pac-Man-themed level appears in Galaga Wars; The flagship from Galaxian is a collectable item in various Pac-Man games; games from the Galaxian series are also included in Pac-Man Arcade Gold, Retro Arcade featuring Pac-Man, Pac-Man Party, Pac-Man Connect and Play. Pac-Man's Pixel Bash and Pac-Man's anniversary arcade cabinets; Pac-Man & Galaga Dimensions is a collection of both Pac-Man and Galaga games.

path.name: Fortnite

Additionally, Samurai-inspired versions of Darth Vader and a Stormtrooper also appear. "Fortnite: Galactic Battle" is a Star Wars-themed season.

path.name: Gravity Falls

path.name: Rick and Morty
path.description: In the Gravity Falls episode "Society of the Blind Eye", Stan loses a coffee mug, notepad, and pen which flies into portal. Those are the same items that came out of a portal in the Rick and Morty episode "Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind". Bill Cipher appears on a monitor in the Rick and Morty episode "Big Trouble in Little Sanchez". In the Rick and Morty episode "The Rickshank Rickdemption", two Mortys can be seen dressed like Dipper and Mabel from Gravity Falls. The creator of Gravity Falls (Alex Hirsch) has also confirmed that the two shows take place in the same universe.

path.description: Characters and locations from Zombies appear in Chibi Tiny Tales.

path.name: Big Hero 6
path.description: Hiro and Baymax from Big Hero 6 appear in "Cheer Tryouts".

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Baymax appears in  Fortnite.

path.name: Maniac Mansion
path.description: Purple Tentacles appear in a bonus level in Zombies Ate My Neighbors.

path.name: Nester
path.description: Nester enters the world of Maniac Mansion in a Howard & Nester comic strip.

path.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
path.description: Nester once met the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael, Michelangelo, April O'Neil, Master Splinter, the Shredder, Krang, Casey Jones, Krang's Android, Bebop and Rocksteady apear in Fortnite. Additionally, the Turtle Van also appears as a Car Body.

path.name: Infestation
path.description: Zombies vs Robots appear in the Infestation Crossover event.

path.name: Transformers
path.description: In Transformers: Infestation it is shown that the world of Transformers is infected by the zombie plague.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Optimus Prime, Optimus Primal, Bumblebee, Megatron and a Battle Bus Transformer appear in Fortnite.

path.name: Godzilla
path.description: Godzilla, Gigan, and King Ghidorah all made appearances in a few episodes of Zone Fighter.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Godzilla Evolved from Godzilla X Kong: The New Empire and Mechagodzilla from Godzilla vs. Kong appear in Fortnite.

path.name: Granblue Fantasy
path.description: Jehuty from Zone of the Enders appears as a summon in Granblue Fantasy as part of a collaboration.

path.name: Street Fighter
path.description: Characters from Street Fighter appear in Granblue Fantasy as part of a collaboration.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Ryu, Chun-Li, Cammy, Guile, Sakura and Blanka from Street Fighter appear in Fortnite.

path.name: Anime Weebs
path.description: A character from Zoomer the Hedgehog appears in the Anime Weebs episode "The Fate of all Weebs".

path.name: Genshin Impact
path.description: Characters from Genshin Impact appear in the Anime Weebs episodes "The problem with Anime girls..." and "All Weebs go to Anime Heaven" as part of a sponsorship from miHoYo.

path.name: Horizon (Sony)
path.description: Aloy from Horizon: Zero Dawn appears in the PS4 and PS5 versions of Genshin Impact as part of a special event.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Aloy appears in Fortnite.

path.name: Big Hero 6
path.description: The Lucky Cat Cafe from Big Hero 6 appears in the film, Zootopia; there is also a calendar showing San Fransokyo, and the cover for a movie titled "Pig Hero 6".

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Baymax appears in  Fortnite.

path.name: Indie Pogo
path.description: Zorbie is a playable character in Indie Pogo.

path.name: Shovel Knight
path.description: Shovel Knight is a playable character in Indie Pogo.

path.name: God of War
path.description: In the Playstation version of Shovel Knight, Kratos from God of War appears as a boss.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Kratos appears in Fortnite.

path.name: Mickey Mouse
path.description: The comic story Operação P.I. 1820 can be considered a crossover between the two series; A character dressed as Zorro, called Little Zorro is featured in some Mickey Mouse strips from 1958 and Zorro can also be seen on TV in a Mickey Mouse comic strip from April 24, 1958 and one from May 15, 1958.

path.name: Peter Pan (Disney)
path.description: Peter Pan Treasure Chest and Mickey Mouse in Fantasyland feature crossover stories between the two series, Peter Pan characters also appear in the Mickey Mouse stories 20,000 Weeds Under The Sea, Treasure Island A-Yo-Ho, Classy Castle Hassle, Topolino allo Zecchino D'Oro, O Sumiço Das Vozes Na Terra Do Nunca and Le capitaine Crochet est de retour !, as well as in Mickey Mousecapade, the Epic Mickey series and the House of Mouse series, additionally a Mary Blair drawing from the production of Peter Pan is shown on a book in the Mickey Mouse episode "Wonders of the Deep".

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Captain Hook appears in Fortnite.

path.name: Peggle
path.description: The ball chasing Warren in the "Great Balls of Ire" level in Peggle Nights is from Zuma; several other levels from this Stage contain references to Zuma.

path.name: Team Fortress
path.description: Characters and locations from Team Fortress 2 appear in Peggle Extreme.

path.name: Fallout
path.description: Team Fortress 2 features a promotional item from Fallout: New Vegas and unlocked by pre-puchasing the game.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: The T-60 Power Armour from Fallout appears in Fortnite as a part of the Chapter 5 Season 3 Battle Pass.

path.name: Looney Tunes
path.description: Bugs Bunny makes an appearance in the film ¡Mucha Lucha!: The Return of El Maléfico.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: LeBron James, based on his appearance from Space Jam: A New Legacy, appears in Fortnite.

path.name: Street Fighter
path.description: Amaterasu, Issun, Susano, Waka, Oki, Sakuya and Yami from Ōkami are selectable in Street Fighter × All Capcom, while there's a reference to Akuma's "Shun Goku Satsu" in  Ōkami.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Ryu, Chun-Li, Cammy, Guile, Sakura and Blanka from Street Fighter appear in Fortnite.

path.name: Super Smash Bros.
path.description: Daemon X Machina spirits are featured in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate.

path.name: Metal Gear
path.description: Snake is unlockable in Super Smash Bros. Brawl, with a stage also based on the series and Gray Fox featured as Assist Trophy; there also is a reference to Super Smash Bros. Melee in Metal Gear Solid: Twin Snakes.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Solid Snake and Raiden appear in Fortnite.

path.name: Resident Evil
path.description: Project X Zone and Project X Zone 2 feature characters from the Resident Evil series.

path.name: Fortnite
path.description: Chris Redfield, Jill Valentine, Leon S. Kennedy and Claire Redfield appear in Fortnite.
